oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War stencil for W. [Walter] C. Tuttle, Co. F, 4th Ill. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This stencil was found in Trenton, Tennessee, at 712 College Street, a building once the parsonage for Andrew College and used by Union troops during the Civil War. Brass stencils of this type were sold to soldiers in order to mark their possessions. This stencil was for Sgt. Walter C. Tuttle, Co. F, 4th Ill. Cav. Regt., USA. The regiment operated in West Tennessee in the summer of 1863 and, after service in Mississippi, sent back to the area in the winter of 1864.
